alert.note: Alert for Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding on the Independence River caused by recent excessive rainfall. * WHERE...On the Independence River in Lewis county. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Independence river and its tributaries and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 657 PM EDT, gauge reports indicates significant rises on the Independence river from heavy rains due to recent thunderstorms. Flooding is imminent or occurring in the warned area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
